The cfgAperi script failed with the same error during Derby db creation after running a sql command from file AlterVersion005000002.sql.

The Java Exception points to illegal character used in a textfile that are invalid for the selected character-set.
After converting the AlterVersion005000002.sql file to UTF-8 (java standard) the cfgAperi script run fine on Linux. The error was caused by some single quotation in the script comments.

I found the same wrong characters in the EPL.txt file included in the aperi.install plugin in the /resources folder.
After replacing the single quotations with the UTF-8 encoded the Aperi graphical installer came up.
checked in UTF-8 encoded versions of EPL.txt and AlterVersion005000002.sql.
fixed Linux installer launch script also.
